subj-group.subject: SECCION III: SEMIOTICA JURÍDICA: EL LENGUAJE DEL DERECHO, SU FORMALIZACION Y SU REPRESENTACION INFORMÁTICA

title-group.article-title: SEMIOTIQUE ET DROIT: EXERCICE DE LECTURE

abstract.p: Language and judicial activities are both signs of the existence of a society. There is, therefore, good reason for a dialogue between the science of language and the science of law. This article applies a linguistic theory of the Paris School (semiotics) to the examination of a legal text, namely a contract. The author points to some elements shared by legal and other texts, and demonstrates how a semiotic interpretation can provide interesting and unexpected insights into the deeper levels of a legal text. He concludes that a similar approach could fruitfully be used with other types of legal text.
